title: How to explain gravity exists to someone who believes it does not - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on what their reasons are and what they believe the alternative to gravity is. Well, first of all, we must acknowledge the fact that everything on the surface of Earth has a weight. Weight, by definition, is a force, F = MA. Calculating weight(W = mg)is the act same as calculating force, the notation is just different and there’s the use of a constant. This is in accordance to Newton’s second law. So, where exactly is this force coming from ? What’s causing it ? Something must be. What you can point them to is experiments that also demonstrate the fact that mass attracts mass, an example being the cavendish experiment. There’s also experiments you can perform with really sensitive scales where you can test the same thing by hanging a mass from the scale then placing a mass under that object at a very close proximity. If the scale is sensitive enough you should see that a small amount of weight is added. This expected weight can be calculated with the law of gravity, F = G(M1(M2)) / r ^ 2. I’m assuming the people you’re referring to are flat Earthers. If they believe buoyancy is what causes things to fall then their are some very easy ways to demonstrate that this simply isn’t the. One of these demonstrations is the fact that to calculate the buoyant force on Earth you need the gravitational constant. The equation is F = pgV, where p is the fluid density, g is acceleration do to gravity and V is the volume of displaced fluid. On top of that, the buoyant force is not a downward force, it’s an upward force. The buoyant force is working against gravity, and for the buoyant force to exist their must be some force or acceleration mimicking a force in a particular direction. If you’ve ever seen buoyancy experiments in free fall, you’ll see that their is no buoyancy for exactly the same reason I just mentioned. There’s also a simple experiment you can do in a car. If you have a balloon in a car and accelerate forward the balloon will move to the front of the car rather than backwards. All the air is being pushed forward, and do to buoyancy the air floats forward just as it would float up into the atmosphere.
